page.title: 12GODLINGSTON FARM SWANAGE
page.content: Godlingston Manor farm consists of 240 acres of farming land and 237 acres of woodland and hills. It is a dairy farm with over 100 cows and a bull called William. Most of the land is used for grazing, silage and hay. The rest is used for growing wheat and barley. Most of the farms in Purbeck are small; Godlingston is one of the largest. Three men work at Godlingston with up to date equipment. The farmer can milk 110 cows in 2 hours and get 519,000 litres of milk each day. He is paid 14p per litre in the Winter and 10p per litre in the Summer. Godlingston is owned by the National Trust and contains many wild animals and flowers including orchids. There is also a secret colony of the rare Adonis Blue butterfly.
